meanings.definition: A feeling of fear or disgust
meanings.sent1: The creeps I got from watching that horror movie made me shiver.
meanings.sent2: The sight of spiders gives me the creeps.
meanings.sent3: I can't help but laugh at how my little brother's silly monster costume gives me the creeps.
meanings.sent4: The eerie silence in the abandoned house sent shivers of creeps down my spine.
meanings.sent5: The creepy shadows in the dimly lit alley filled me with a sense of creeps.

meanings.sent1: The cat creeps up on its prey before pouncing.
meanings.sent2: I crept out of the room so as not to wake anyone.
meanings.sent3: The detective creeps around the crime scene, searching for clues.
meanings.sent4: The fog creeps in, covering the town in a mysterious haze.
meanings.sent5: The vines slowly creep along the garden wall, reaching for the sunlight.

meanings.definition: A person who behaves in a strange or unpleasant way
meanings.sent1: That guy at the party was a real creep, making everyone uncomfortable.
meanings.sent2: She always avoids the creeps who hang out by the alley.
meanings.sent3: The creepy neighbor always gives out strange candies on Halloween.
meanings.sent4: The creep in the horror movie turned out to be the least expected character.
meanings.sent5: The old mansion was rumored to be haunted by a ghostly creep who roamed the halls at night.
